tool.name: Epifany
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && export PYTHONPATH='$__tool_directory__/CTDopts/' && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input: identification results

param.name: protein_fdr
param.label: Additionally calculate the target-decoy FDR on protein-level based on the posteriors

param.name: greedy_group_resolution
param.label: Post-process inference output with greedy resolution of shared peptides based on the parent protein probabilities
param.help: Also adds the resolved ambiguity groups to output

param.name: max_psms_extreme_probability
param.label: Set PSMs with probability higher than this to this maximum probability

param.name: psm_probability_cutoff
param.label: Remove PSMs with probabilities less than or equal this cutoff

param.name: top_PSMs
param.label: Consider only top X PSMs per spectrum

param.name: update_PSM_probabilities
param.label: (Experimental:) Update PSM probabilities with their posteriors under consideration of the protein probabilities

param.name: user_defined_priors
param.label: (Experimental:) Uses the current protein scores as user-defined priors

param.name: annotate_group_probabilities
param.label: Annotates group probabilities for indistinguishable protein groups (indistinguishable by experimentally observed PSMs)

param.name: use_ids_outside_features
param.label: (Only consensusXML) Also use IDs without associated features for inference?

section.name: model_parameters
section.title: Model parameters for the Bayesian network

param.name: prot_prior
param.label: Protein prior probability ('gamma' parameter)
param.help: Negative values enable grid search for this param

param.name: pep_emission
param.label: Peptide emission probability ('alpha' parameter)
param.help: Negative values enable grid search for this param

param.name: pep_spurious_emission
param.label: Spurious peptide identification probability ('beta' parameter)
param.help: Usually much smaller than emission from proteins. Negative values enable grid search for this param

param.name: pep_prior
param.label: Peptide prior probability (experimental, should be covered by combinations of the other params)

param.name: regularize
param.label: Regularize the number of proteins that produce a peptide together (experimental, should be activated when using higher p-norms)

param.name: extended_model
param.label: Uses information from different peptidoforms also across runs (automatically activated if an experimental design is given!)

section.name: loopy_belief_propagation
section.title: Settings for the loopy belief propagation algorithm

param.name: scheduling_type
param.label: (Not used yet) How to pick the next message: priority = based on difference to last message (higher = more important)
param.help: fifo = first in first out. random_spanning_tree = message passing follows a random spanning tree in each iteration

param.name: convergence_threshold
param.label: Initial threshold under which MSE difference a message is considered to be converged

param.name: dampening_lambda
param.label: Initial value for how strongly should messages be updated in each step
param.help: 0 = new message overwrites old completely (no dampening; only recommended for trees),0.5 = equal contribution of old and new message (stay below that),In-between it will be a convex combination of both. Prevents oscillations but hinders convergence

param.name: max_nr_iterations
param.label: (Unused, autodetermined) If not all messages converge, how many iterations should be done at max?

param.name: p_norm_inference
param.label: P-norm used for marginalization of multidimensional factors
param.help: 1 == sum-product inference (all configurations vote equally) (default),<= 0 == infinity = max-product inference (only best configurations propagate)The higher the value the more important high probability configurations get

param.name: aucweight
param.label: How important is AUC vs calibration of the posteriors
param.help: 0 = maximize calibration only, 1 = maximize AUC only, between = convex combination

param.name: conservative_fdr
param.label: Use (D+1)/(T) instead of (D+1)/(T+D) for parameter estimation

param.name: conservative_fdr
param.label: Use (D+1)/(T) instead of (D+1)/(T+D) for reporting protein FDRs

param.name: min_psms_extreme_probability
param.label: Set PSMs with probability lower than this to this minimum probability

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

tool.help:
Runs a Bayesian protein inference.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_Epifany.html
